8-dK2mlB8JDsVgBk7OWf4A.text: We come to this restaurant for every special occasion and I have to say we have yet to be disappointed! We recently went for a birthday and again, the food was incredible and the service was stellar! Our waiter was attentive and knowledgeable and very friendly. His recommendation for a main meal was perfect - the sea bass was flavorful and had a nice spicy bite to it (which our waiter mentioned so we would know what to expect). I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants great food, attentive service, and a beautiful view and we will continue to come here again and again!

598IqlVHaNdn1iwLQC1qVw.text: Happy hour food is great but most servers make you feel like you are bothering them. What gives. We observed walkins waiting and waiting to be seater. Hostess of wandering around and in back. Not attentitive at all.

yMYqorPLLuDXx6Qrbf-uPg.text: Waiter was great, but we were kicked out because somebody needed our table. The restaurant was EMPTY and at least ten tables around us were open. I understand the point of reservations, but still it was early in the night and nobody was around us. There was no point in kicking us out so rudely! We'll never be coming back.

jDoQpizVwibC-i15ReOZKg.text: This used to be my all time favorite restaurant; I would want every birthday celebration and special occasion to be here, but sadly not anymore. The location of the Chart House is beautiful and elegant, it has the bones to be a 5 star luxurious dining experience. Unfortunately this place is far from what it once was. It used to have some of the best service, steaks, seafood, salad bar, and mud pie around...now the only thing it can boast is the view.   So let's start with the view since it is gorgeous and on the water, it makes for a romantic setting. Sadly the furniture and decor are dated, torn, and neglected which makes a fancy and expensive dining experience not quite as enjoyable or comfortable. The service used to be top notch, but it seems as though the staff knows the restaurant is going downhill and they are cranky and don't care about their jobs anymore.   The food used to be divine, but it is far from it now. The plates no longer look appetizing, and the salad bar is a a mere shadow of what it was in its former glory. The salad bar is what I used to look forward to the most, but you might has well just go to super salad.  I am so sad that the Chart House has let itself go. This was once a wonderful place that is now not worth the money or the time since there are so many other great places around to enjoy a good meal. If you just want some wine and dessert with a pretty view then by all means enjoy, but if you are looking for more go elsewhere.

y8wJBQphWDLky-ooDkWTog.text: Very nice setting but the food is sub par.  Usually just have seafood here because there are a number of far better steak houses in Scottsdale, but my last visit, even the seafood was lacking.  Shrimp was very strong smelling and tasting. I believe I'll not go to Chart House again unless I'm in Hawaii.

8J-7AR5GacwxmcQ4mk8mzw.text: While visiting the area friends asked us to join them for dinner at the Chart House last night.      Most enjoyable evening was had by all! Our server, Amy was delightful and very attentive to our party. The ambience was A + - great views of the lake and beautiful lighting inside and out.       The food was good but veggies and potatoes were on the cold side and portions were small. Salad bar was expansive and made up for smaller portions. East Coast oysters were also a hit!       Would definitely return.

k-U0M9Jve_rahPGDjbHmbQ.text: Okay. Ordered medium rare NY Strip and it came out medium well, dry and little flavor. Longhorns is a lot better quality.

kkGbgwAyPiyOgaulRLfTTw.text: The location and ambiance are flawless! Great service and management. The food is just not there yet, cocktails were just ok. I understand that Phoenix is not a coastal city, but the sea food quality here is just not as fantastic as the interior design. I will not go back, however, I do recommend the experience.

plBc_t5sNLU6_7SbpkHXWw.text: Have you ever heard the expression "Presentation is Everything!", well this is one of the times that doesn't apply.   The presentation of the food is great and the ambiance and scenery is great as well, however the taste of the food is just so-so.   Me and my wife went to The Chart House to take advantage of their Restaurant Week 3-Course Special.   We both started with the Caesar Salad, which was small and had a string Anchovy taste. The parmesan cheese and croutons were good and the salad was crisp but the dressing ruined the salad. For great Caesar Salad go to The Melting Pot or Mad Greens  We shared the Macadamia Nut Encrusted Chicken and the Maple & Ginger Glazed Salmon, both came with Coconut Ginger Rice.  The Chicken was served in a peanut sauce which didn't really add to the Chicken, the Chicken was good but would have been better if the macadamia nuts were crushed rather than larger chopped pieces. The Salmon tasted like plain salmon, apparently the Maple ginger glaze was either forgotten or it just ran off the salmon to the bottom of the dish because that was the only place there was any sauce.  The Coconut Ginger Rice didn't have any noticeable Coconut flavor or Coconut flakes, and the ginger flavor wasn't very pleasing.   We finished with the Vanilla Creme Brulee, which was done perfect and was very good.   If I were to go again i would probably try the Crispy Coconut Shrimp because that's hard to get wrong or just have the Creme Brulee and a drink after the sun goes down.   WARNING: The chairs in the back room by the deck are very uncomfortable. The chair legs extend all the way up into the chair pad, not under it, and jam you in the bottom of your legs.   Last critique about this restaurant, the floor plan is very cramped with pillars in wall way areas and the waiting area/host counter is in the path to get to the restrooms or out of the restaurant and feels like an obstacle course. Really needs a new floor plan.

BG_ZQxWg_lNTTFSoHMwhIw.text: Hadn't been to the Chart House in ten years and I won't be going back.  The view is always good but that's about it.  I can't believe people will spend that much money for terrible seafood when they can go to the Salt Cellar for the same price or even Ocean Club.  We spent $92.00 for two of us, no alcohol, coinciding with the salad bar.  That's an extra $9.00.  My Caesar salad was the best part of the meal.  I had shrimp stuffed with crab and my wife had scallions and shrimp.  The shrimp reminded me of the kind you buy frozen at the supermarket; they were small and rubbery.  I doubt they were even fresh.  I'd rate them with the same quality as the Red Lobster or even worse.  The crab stuffing was okay but it didn't match up with the Salt Cellar.  I can't comment on the Scallions because I never eat them but my wife left one over.  I thought she was getting sick. The service was fine but nothing special.  Stay away, make a reservation a week early for the Ocean Club or Cellar; you wont be disappointed.

Qk20KAzDebdId_A6CSFrPQ.text: Located over a lake in the scottsdale area serves fresh fish daily and high end cuts of meat.

jqXCs7UzqUS-CP1yms7yhQ.text: Really nice meal. Great setting and very good service. A little pricey but worth it. Enjoyed the presentation as well. Had the special shrimp and scallops and it was great. All the seating has a nice view.

XT1ZrpE2OV5Rvy1f2UKR3w.text: The Chart House restaurant is one of those rare finds in the high stakes restaurant business in Scottsdale. Instead of the kitschy, music pounding, over the top environment, you are welcomed into a classy restaurant where the goal is allow you to relax and enjoy the dinner experience rather than being overwhelmed by it. The hostess immediately welcomed us and immediately sat us with a view of both the outside fireplace and the lake. Our server Kelly immediately made us feel welcome and ensured that our drink order were placed and that she was available to answer any questions. Her super customer service continued throughout the evening.   We started with the Chart House chopped salad and the special tempura shrimp rolls. The salad was extremely fresh and crisp with wonderful made-in-house dressings. The tempura shrimp rolls tasted good but had a rather thick tempura crust and had to much rice compared to the amount of shrimp. Two of the party had crab cakes for dinner which filled with lump crab and were very tasty. The other member of the party had the prime rib which was a generous portion, perfectly cooked and great taste especially with some fresh horseradish. Unfortunately we didn't have room for desert since we would have liked to have tried their signature lava cake.   Bottom line a great experience both in terms of customer service and food but they could have done a bit better on the food (e.g. lighter and more shrimp for the shrimp roles, etc). However all around very much worthy of another visit.

t9zN-siqDkKN3DxYdtmP6Q.text: Would never go here again. Hosted a grp of 8 Professionals and wanted to try something different. Sadly disappointed - and food poisoned.  Summary of menu items tried: Coconut Shrimp: prepared from frozen and shrimp was not deveined (gross)!  Salad bar: Fresh, but far from interesting for the price.  Filet: totally unseasoned, tasted like boiled! Tough and chewy. Could not finish. Teriyaki Fillet Medallions: Sauce from a bottle from "Safeway". Very bad and chewy/tough.  Sea Bass: Wasn't sea bass. Was prepared from frozen, overcooked and totally unseasoned. Orzo reheated from yesterday with a "skin" on top!  Service: knew that 18% tip mandatory. Was TERRIBLE, inattentive and SLOW.  Only reason I paid the "mandatory tip" is because I didn't want to make a scene with all of my guests.    I am NOT HAPPY with the ripoff that the Chart House gave us tonight.  That waiter made over $80 in "mandatory tips"  from my bill.  I am blessed to have been successful in business, and I am normally pleased to pay my bills - but I worked very hard for my money and I hate being ripped off.  And the Chart House ripped me off.  Called Management later to complain about the low quality food and service. Will see what happens to be fair and will update this.  Manager on the phone said that he would "inform corporate" about our complaint.  Should note that two guests (the ones that had the Caesar salads) ended up getting very ill later that night.  The likely culprit is food poisoning from the Caesar Salads.  All in agreement (several of us are Physicians and Nurses).

oNkUk4dqSTPMLatmviX0Ww.text: I have dined at many Chart House restaurants across the country and they were all consistently good in regards to location, ambiance, food, and service. Unfortunately, this was not the birthday experience I had hoped for with my family. The hostess made us wait over 25 minutes for a reservation (Landrys VIP) even though the restaurant was empty. She was very unprofessional and didn't have a care in the world for me or the other groups waiting. The main server attempted to do a better job but I could easily overhear hear and other waiters and staff complaining about the customers near the salad area. Again, extremely unprofessional. I have always had great experiences at Chart House but this was a major let down especially on a day of celebration

ihOOnEkbnNAbl-tmde9Img.text: Our waiter was great but I'm sorry but I don't like hearing the manager yell at his employees right near our table. The food is sub par. I could have a better salad at super salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I don&#39;t know what kind of classy salad this is but it sure looks like the lettuce is going bad to me.

6F0hFPWtKu4sgu7YKKlQWw.text: I have eaten here lots of times but just last Friday I went out for dinner and had Lobster. It was the sweetest Lobster that I have ever eaten outside of Maine, The view is great and the food is always first class.

C3yyEhR3x3qwEp0zGunKag.text: I have had a great experience both times that I have eaten here. The food is very good and so is the service. My favorite is the macademian nut crusted Mahi Mahi and the chocolate Lava cake. My husband had the sea bass and was very happy. The server was a little robotic but everything came in a timely manner and she checked on us often. Overall, it was a very nice experience.

1-1VkTNWsQt8s5Gqc6AFUA.text: We had a lovely evening here. The service was good and the food was excellent. I had the macadamia crusted mahi and loved it. My husband commented that the salad bar was very good and enjoyed his prime rib. They have a great wine selection. Beautiful view, also!

lfYGVQXylSZnuOP3JYx9zQ.text: We had 6 adults   and 2 children in our party to celebrate an anniversary, we arrived at 5.30 on a Monday Night, we were seated in 10 minutes at a table across the restaurant away from other diners.   I thought something might be a little wrong when I had to make two trips  from the bar to bring our own drinks to the table.    We were seated and were given menus.  That is when the real waiting started.  We asked if there were any specials and we were told it is on the menu, my father informed the waiter that he is legally blind and asked for assistance, so the waiter proceeded to read the fish specials over the shoulder of his wife.   While the group was deciding, my father ordered a bottle of champagne to be delivered for this special occasion.   Glasses were brought to the table but I think they had to go to France to get the selection.    The table presentation was very nice but we were given an additional black napkin to everyone but the patriarch.    Finally the last napkin was delivered and the champagne was poured.   Our orders were taken and then the real waiting began.   At 6.45pm (remember we were seated at 5.30) we inquired where our appetizers were and asked for another drink order.   We were told they were coming.   The shrimp and oysters were delivered but the three bowls of lobster bisque soup did not arrive.   When they finally arrived they were  luke warm.   They were sent back and when they were returned, you could tell that they had been microwaved in the same bowl.   Needless to say, there were returned again.      We again waited for the entrees and had to call the waiter over to service the table, to remove the dirty glasses and again refresh the drink orders.    Finally at 7.20pm our entrees arrived.   The presentation was very good but some of the orders were missing items.   (the filet did not arrive with the additional crab that was ordered and when it was delivered  it was in a  ramekin.   The mashed potatoes were cold.   We were not going to send them back to the microwave.  When we finished the waiter came to ask if we wanted dessert but we were never offered coffee.   We asked for the bill.   The bill was delivered but the dirty dinner dishes were never removed.     Suffice it to say the whole evening was a disaster.   My father wanted this dinner to be a special for my husbands and my 29th wedding anniversary.   We left after my husband his "third chat with the Manager" leaving a 1.00 tip on a 450.00 tab.   My husband told the manager he owed the tip to the waiter for not providing the proper support  to get the job done.   We also mentioned that  they should clean up the goose poop from the front enterance before the dinner service is started.    We realize that part of the resturant's charm is the water setting with the wildlife but to walk trough it entering and leaving is not very desirable.       This was not our first experience with this property but will be our last until management is skilled on proper service for a 5 star restaurant.

WWw-h9cDnMFSnj0nHR4vJQ.text: If you really LIKE cold seafood, tepid prime rib, then THIS is the restaurant for you!  Table of eight, seated quickly, waiter was a little flustered and brought the wrong item completely for one of our friends.  It happens. Our plates were well presented, and the meal looked fabulous, but it was cold.  Shrimp was cold, salmon was cold, fries were cold.  Three diners sent their plates back.  The prime rib was tepid, and the potatoes were warm.  Not hot.  So the diners who didn't have food simply entertained the ones who were eating.  That's the one star.  The waiter apologized, the manager apologized.  She didn't offer to comp ANYTHING, she didn't offer dessert or a glass of wine.  Oh, and the tip was already on the bill, 18%....which was probably a good thing for our inept waiter.  Don't bother, there are plenty of great places in Scottsdale to dine.

0vctXqA2YWAUbTBhEEOS6w.text: Did restaurant week here last night, have to say we were underwhelmed. The macadamia nut chicken was pretty tasteless and the garlic tilapia was watery mush. The mud pie however was out of this world and worth the price of the meal.

XM5qLR-1ESLSZ1Ojbakslw.text: We decided to try this place for Restaurant Week last night and ended up walking out!   The hostess was rude, sat others before us even though we had a reservation, and did not give us Restaurant Week menus.  Then the waiter seemed "put out" when we asked for them.  My friend had a bug in her water and asked the waiter for a new glass...he took it from her without an appology and when he brought her a new glass, said "here ya go".   Maybe it was an off night for the staff, but we will never go back to find out.

3hqECl04Bi8lC25VtIEeDw.text: Love this restaurant, beautiful setting with quality food and reasonable pricing. The soup trio app is fantastic, as are the lobster shrimp rolls! This place deserves more praise and recognition than it gets!!

5WcV5PxxtSnOV0f2_ZLm1A.text: Went to Chart House on a Friday evening at 7:30.  They were not busy at all.  You'd think that we would get quick service as they were not busy - no way..... the waiter was pleasant, the salad bar pretty good, the view was nice, the food - just ok.  The food coming out of the kitchen was s l o w. Really not worth going back to when there are so many other worthy restaurants.

r7U06LMc7JaoFiIE6CbB9A.text: Last night we had the WORST dining experience ever!  Normally we love the Chart House. We are even Landry club card members.  It took 15 minutes to get even a glass of water, another 20 to get a glass of wine, 40 minutes to receive our COLD entree.  The waitress  was running.  Where was the manager..arguing with other patrons!!!  Why didn't he help out if they were short staffed? Maybe he needs to take a lesson in being on the team!  Don't know if we will ever come back.  Sad, as we have been loyal customers for over 25 years.  People, find somewhere else to dine.

OHzdlInIeLayLVWvymEfdQ.text: I arrived on time for my reservation but the hostess twirled her hair for 5 minutes before acknowledging me. Then she told me to sit at the bar. My table was ready but she wasn't. Really?   My friends and I were looking forward to the once infamous salad bar, but we discovered 5 empty ingredient bowls and a manager too busy to restock right then. Attitudes are awful. So was the food. Time for the restaurant to rethink who and what they are.

N_0cYWtwZGgVGJ2MG1D7Wg.text: We decided to stop in on Monday April 27th for National Prime Rib Day that the restaurant was promoting.  I made reservation and we got there 15 mins early.  The place looked moderately busy, but not packed.  Not sure why it still took the hostess so long to seat us.  We got seated, and yes, the view is beautiful, but the service was very very slow.  We tried to order the oysters as appetizers, but they were out, so we went with the Ahi Tuna Tacos.  It took our server 15 mins to come back to tell us that they are out of those as well?  Why would it take them that long when the restaurant was not that busy to begin with?  Needless to say, we are disappointed in that.  Then comes the prime ribs.  I'd say the prime rib is just average because it looks and taste like the prime ribs you get at a buffet. Then our server just disappeared.  It was the longest dinner service which I don't understand how that is even possible when it's slow and on a Monday night.  I've been to the one out on Redondo Beach, CA. and LOVE the service and food there.  I just don't think the one here in Arizona is as good as the one in California.  I would say I would not come back here to dine because it's really just the "view" and since I love food, I expect better food for the prices on the menu.

KYzKAkmJVoh0UBYDE0wlzQ.text: We've been to the Chart House three or four times.  We have always received great food and service, and a nice view.  A hidden gem.  We'll definitely be going back.

vtAZ0UmstuEStLHe05z8Ig.text: Went here with some of my gal pals to celebrate a birthday.  I must admit, I was a bit hesitant to come here since the overall rating on Yelp is three stars, but I was at a convention that was close, and my friends accommodated me in having it at this location.  Since there were five of us, we ordered quite a bit on the happy hour menu to try it out.  We had the firecracker shrimp, fried artichoke hearts, lettuce wraps, kimchi calamari, prime rib sliders, shrimp tacos.   And to top it off, we all shared in a lick-the-plate chocolate pie.  I tried everything except the sliders and the tacos.   My favorite was the shrimp.   Quite tasty.  We each had two drinks, mine being the titos martini.  Jesus was our server, and was quite friendly and professional.  Luke, the manager, came by a couple of times to make sure everyone was enjoying herself.  I would return.   The view is appealing since the room is surrounded by windows.

ncUlfWiKK11jJD5A7NtlTQ.text: We called ahead to see if they had room for 2 people for dinner. They put me on hold had to get the manager, she discouraged me from coming. Saying they might be able to get us in at 7:30 but she wasn't sure.  We came in because we really wanted to eat there.  We show up and the place is not even 1/3 full. There were 25-30 people in the restaurant that easily holds 100 people.  Then my husband orders the steak and crab legs. They don't have steak sauce. They only have one bottle at a time and they didn't have anything for the steak. So my husband ate his steak dry.  The bottle of red wine was hot and had to be put in ice to cool it to "cellar temperature ". Why would anyone want to drink red wine at 74 degrees??

Uy7Cy-M1jQ1Wc_ipMzu_Pw.text: There were literally too many mishaps to go into detail about each one so I'll try to make this as concise as possible: -We made a reservation. When we arrive we ask for a seat near a window for the lake view (it's nearing sunset) and are told there none available. I count 3 on our walk to our table. We're seated just slightly back but still have an ok view of the lake. -The waiter seems nervous. I assume he's new, no big deal. Shortly after serving us our drinks he knocks over a full glass of ice water on the table and into my husbands lap. Still no big deal, who hasn't spilled water? -We ask a bus boy (who didn't see it happen) to replace the wet linens so my husband doesn't have wet arms and legs. The bus boy grabs a dry corner of the table cloth, and questions "this is wet?" we explain the situation and he reluctantly agrees to change it out.  -We're standing around awkwardly while they switch them out and move to the bar so we're not in the way of the waitstaff.  -While at the bar we see our table is ready and begin to walk over seconds before we get there the hostess seats another group at our table and we immediately explain the situation to her away from the group that has just been seated. She doesn't know what to do so we let our server know and walk back to the bar. We've already ordered at this point otherwise we'd have just left.  -Amber, the manager, comes out and rather than starting with an apology says in an accusatory way "what seems to be the problem?" Even though she must already know. She does apologize at the end of our explanation and offers us a table even further back from the lake view.  -Once seated we're offered bread. And then have to ask 3 times to actually get it.  -My husband and I ordered our steaks medium rare plus. His was much more rare than mine and Amber asked if it was ok I told her I ordered it medium (because I usually do but had ordered it slightly more rare than usual based off our waiter's description of how they do medium). She says it is medium and walks off, without giving me time to explain my brief memory lapse.  -my husband's steak was supposed to come with grilled onions, it didn't again no apology from Amber just "I can bring grilled onions" and she did.  -Our desserts were supposed to be comp'd so we ordered 2 total, for each couple to share. My husband orders the lava cake that takes up to 30 minutes to make and 5 minutes after ordering it Amber comes by our table to let us know she took someone else's  lava cake order and made sure it would come to us instead for all the trouble. She says it will be here in 10-12 minutes. Nice gesture, but 35 minutes after ordering it we get his lava cake.  -Our friends insisted in paying the bill which we would have preferred to pay since we made the reservation and felt awful about the experience. As far as I heard they took 20 off the bill which is irrelevant. The issue wasn't the bill. It was honestly the absolute worst customer service and dining experience EVER!   -I ALMOST FORGOT THERE WAS A WEDDING GOING ON ACROSS THE LAKE AND A FIREWORKS DISPLAY FROM A BOAT WHICH WE COULDN'T SEE  BECAUSE THEY MOVED OUR TABLE.  It's a mid range restaurant as far as price goes so I wasn't expecting high end service, but this was absolutely ridiculous. Amber is not good at her job. Literally just start with an apology. We were super reasonable, at not one point were we rude or combative. At our absolute worst we were direct. We were INCREDIBLY patient through all the mess ups, and this should have been handled better.

HYAjBMep8E9wo-Jzjc0yMw.text: The Chart House used to be our celebration restaurant. Not anymore. After poor service following our engagement, right outside the restaurant, we will never be back. The quality of the Chart House has significantly diminished over the last few years, no thanks to the general manager who has been there for decades.

ek94fEZzBgm1o0EXjbtA5w.text: Seriously such a waste of time and money.  Worst meal and experience ever.  Waiter was horrible and food not even close to being nice.  You could have the same steak at Denny's.  You assume when you're paying $45 for a steak you might be able to let them know what cut of prime rib you would like. My dad ordered an end cut prime rib which the waiter rolled his eyes  at his request.   Worst waiter I e ever had at a nice restaurant.  He had curly hair blindfish brown hair make sure you don't get him.  It was an experience you would have expected at Denny's not with a $300 dinner.  The Prime Rib came out half fat and when we told the manager he said prime rib is fatty.   The waiter rolled his eyes so many times I stopped counting. He is what you call an order taker. We also asked for creamy horseradish and he said they didn't have it but of course it came on the dish. The waiter was a complete jackass and completely ruined our experience. I feel bad because my dad paid and this was a big deal to take us all out and this was our experience.    If you want to spend $40 on a steak going anywhere else and you'll have a better meal and experience.

zd6K-mQCqNbbEt4_x-rQZg.text: I live very close to the Chart House restaurant and have eaten there many times. Took a business friend there Sunday night 8/4/19 for dinner. The food was good as always but the service was absolutely horrible. Our server was awol most of the time. Asked for some lemons with my water...never came. Had to get up and get some myself from a lady at the salad bar myself. My prime came and she disappeared once again without leaving me a steak knife. Again, I had to get up and wave another server down to get a knife while my entree grew cold. Again, our water glasses were empty and no server to be found. There is no excuse for such neglect. I won't be back!

umTOYaA1mtRx3E6QDKnI3Q.text: The whole experience is between a 3 and 4 stars, but I give this restaurant 4 because, overall, you get out satisfied.  The unbeatable element of this restaurant is the location: the Camelback lake offers a relaxing and romantic view with a cozy atmosphere that will make you enjoy your meal even more.  My father and I decided to dine here on a Wednesday night, the day before Thanksgiving. I was glad to observe the restaurant was quite full, yet, we were seated at our favorite table right at the window on the lake shore.  I recommend getting here at the sunset to take nice pictures, although even at night the view is still beautiful.  Both my father and I had seafood: his Alaskan crab legs were delicious, a bit small, but good. I got the saute sea bass which was very delicate in taste. Ask for the salad bar before your entrees, it's only $9.50/person and you can go back and forth as many times as you want!  And now the less positive aspect: the service. For being an upscale restaurant with entrees that ranges from $40 to $60, service was a bit slow and careless. I'm not referring to our waitress only but also to buss boys and staff in general.  Our waitress (I don't want to mention the name) was maybe too busy to bother to come to our table to check if everything was okay. Small things like missing silverware or asking if everything was okay.  When taking our orders, she mentioned that their chocolate lava cake takes approximately 25-30 minutes to cook, so she asked if we wanted one right at the beginning and we said yes. However, after we were done with our meals we still waited half an hour for the lava cake to come out. So I don't get the point of asking beforehand if you still have to wait that long!  No specials either. In the end, I still tipped more than 20% just because I don't believe in the "punishment of the tip". But I hope the staff will read this review and recognize to pay more attention next time. Food was amazing, service so so.  Will I return ? Of course, but next time, if something goes wrong, I may have a word or two with the manager.

VwJy4cfE26S4q-7x1fByug.text: Came here with my husband and had the Coconut Shrimp with some white wine.  The ambiance is great - if a bit loud - and the service was okay.  It was quite busy for a Thursday I thought but the weather has been nice so I think people are getting out there!    The reservation was handled by my husband and we did not have to wait long.  The view was worth it although we did not get seated by a window as requested.  Thats why I am giving them 3 stars or else it would have been a solid four.

ZZfJA4wdckmS8fPmb9MKFg.text: Excellent seafood restaurant.  Good, and not to expensive choice for seafood options in the desert.  There were some things missing from the menu since the last time I went, which was a little disappointing, but that's ok.

XVzo0KpJsWzx_fNPo0eP6A.text: We came here for my mother's birthday. We had a reservation for 6 pm and got there at 5:30 and were promptly seated. (Request a window seat---great view!) The only negative was the happy hour menu is only available at the bar, and there is limited bar seating, which is first come first serve--understandable. They have a bountiful salad bar with many organic options. The marinated mushrooms and the build your own Caesar salad were my favorite. I saw many positive reviews about the coconut shrimp appetizer so of course we had to get that. I had the coconut shrimp app, the sword fish entree, and the salad bar. Didn't even need to think about dessert because the watermelon and pineapple on the salad bar was perfection, but our waiter was extra attentive and heard me say it was my mother's birthday and brought what tasted like tiramisu ice cream with a candle. The coconut shrimp app came with three different dipping sauces and a unique presentation in an edible rice bowl. The swordfish was perfectly grilled--juicy! The organic vegetables with the entree- perfectly seasoned. Also, the rice had a really unique flavor--and I don't usually eat rice! A great time was had by all.

photos.caption: Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Swordfish entree
Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Birthday surprise!
Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bread and butter

jFJUXi2UzJ9ujlgCvRBdpQ.text: When you walk into this place it's like it's 1995 still and I forgot how bad restaurant service was in the 1990s. We came here on a Friday night at 7 o'clock and literally we were not even spoken to by a single staff person for over 30 minutes no chairs no seating no availability over a one hour wait   I'll prefer to go back to the future of 2019 and find a new restaurant. we won't be back ever again and I feel bad for those forced to come here with their grandparents.

7mb1YCpCgCu1AOVC-_ZqSg.text: Met up here for dinner with friends and was greeted by an awesome view. We were a party of 7 including kids... you can just imagine the look we got from other diners who were on dates. Luckily the kids all behaved and ate their sub par meals. I ordered the Mac Mahi, my husband got the soup trio and Halibut while our friends ordered Filet Mignon and King crabs. While the fish were both cooked great the flavor was lacking. Everyone at the table pretty much shared the crab but it didn't taste fresh at all. Joshua, our server, was great and very attentive except he made a joke about one of the kids... something like "he looked like he was having a seizure.." well someone in our table does suffer from epilepsy. Not his fault. But bad joke.

photos.caption: Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ScBquMk8d0zuyU-uoT57kQ.text: We celebrated our 37th wedding anniversary here. We were greeted at the front desk and only waited a few minutes to be seated. Our server, Lindsee was knowledgeable and attentive. The special was Blackened Salmon with three prawns, rice and mixed vegetables. That's what I ordered and when it came out, I saw the butter sauce flow to the other side of the plate as it was being placed in front of me. There was so much butter that it got into my rice and mixed vegetables. Now the prawns that topped the salmon was presented three different ways, one was sliced in half, the other one had the tail and the last one was missing a tail. I was not pleased with my meal and I let the manager know who offered to replace the rice and mixed vegetables. I declined since I was already halfway done with my meal. My wife had the 10 oz prime rib which was tasty but  the meat had about two oz of fat which she removed before eating. The salad bar is the star of the meal with fresh vegetables and a station to have your Cesar Salad prepared. For dessert we had the three flavors of ice cream which were refreshing with a cup of coffee. We been here before and the meal was excellent which is the reason I decided to celebrate our anniversary here.

GGt4XntQtezzxjHWkOLYRQ.text: My heart sank when I walked in and saw the gorgeous view because, with a few rare exceptions, restaurants with great views often have "meh" food because they can count on ambiance for business.   It sank further when I saw the Ponderosa-style salad bar.  Call me a foodie snob but a salad bar is a bad sign much like book-thick menus with pictures.    We sat at the bar with the intent of having a drink before our reservation but the bartender never got to us.    Once seated, my husband ordered a brown derby.  He received a drink that was tasty but it was not, in any way, a brown derby.    My spicy cucumber drink was bland, boring and lacked complexity.  I ordered the tuna and while the tuna was actually decent quality, the preparation was a snooze (shallot butter should have had more flavor).  My mixed vegetables were unevenly cooked - some were mushy, others were raw.    Skip it.  Go to McCormick-Stillman Park for the view and pay Old Town prices at a restaurant with good food.

WTdsGiBbsgG4_-MDJjlMOw.text: Located right on the golf course, we came here to meet a man that we were planning on buying a timeshare from (I'm starting to sense a theme here). At the time, I was pretty young and had to pretend I was "older" to get into the restaurant. I dressed up like an older teen would and ordered shrimp off the starter menu (no kid's meal here). What I remember most were the views. We were seated right next to the window, and even at night, could see the reflection off the water. Everything was decorated nicely in the restaurant and service was friendly. Looking at the menu, it doesn't look like much has changed over the years.

DRNUnjppz8wVXSULegs1eQ.text: Took husband here during Arizona Restaurant week. Everything was delicious! My favorite dishes were the goat cheese appetizer and chocolate creme brulee. We also had sea bass with risotto, coconut shrimp, mud pie, and a soup menage that was on the regular menu.  We went on a Sunday evening so it wasn't crowded at all. In fact, we had the entire bar area to ourselves. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We definitely plan to bring family visitors back with us the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate Creme Brûlée
Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Risotto and Cranberry Sea Bass
Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kalamata and Artichoke Tapenade

f_hW0ErRuRgGq-GuynsOMQ.text: We had dinner tonight after several visits. We will not be back! Service at a table in bar was absolutely terrible. Our waitress was too busy stocking the bar to even close us out. Dishes weren't picked up. Menu left on table entire dinner. When we talked to the manager she said "oh she usually doesn't wait tables " like that was our unfortunate luck. Manager busy on her cell phone couldn't even get her attention. This is not the Chart House we know!

zSRS-DrwL6crtpq_2slqrw.text: Great food!!!!  We had reservations with our vendor here and the food was so good! They offer a salad bar, but I had to pass it on it. A few of the others had to check out the caviar on the salad bar. I was eyeing the lobster bisque and maize shrimp and scallops. The food was good! I did wish the dish had spice, but that's because I like spicy dishes.  The other guests with our party really enjoyed their dishes. The desserts looked good, but I was too stuffed from dinner. Our servers provided awesome service to us. Nobody went without anything. The view here is beautiful. Who doesn't like to see mountains in the background with cactus and palm trees?! Thank you for the awesome service and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish with Baja topping (shrimp, avocado corn salsa)
Photo of Chart House - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Maize Shrimp and Scallops
